terms.definition: A public catalog of cybersecurity vulnerabilities providing unique identifiers for known software flaws.
A community-developed list of common software and hardware weakness types.
A standardized scoring system for rating the severity of security vulnerabilities.
A U.S. government repository of standards-based vulnerability management data.
A globally accessible knowledge base of adversary tactics and techniques based on real-world observations.
A regularly updated report outlining the ten most critical web application security risks, published by the Open Web Application Security Project.
